intro: Kuhitangia popovii, commonly known as the Popov's kuhitangia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its unique, fleshy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to the arid and rocky environment of Socotra, showcasing specialized features for water conservation. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, Kuhitangia popovii is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
